intro: Pithecellobium brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed pickerelweed, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in wetlands and along waterways. The plant features palmately compound leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds, which are dispersed by water or wind. Pithecellobium brevipes plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic environments and provides habitat for various aquatic organisms.
